p:
The final step of our approach consists in combining all pruned graphs into a single graph G by intersection ( Fig 1G), which we formally note G = ⋂
n
G
n . The graph intersection is achieved by retaining edges present in all the individual graphs, so that G = { N, E} with E = {( i, j) | ( i, j) ∈ E
n ∀ n}. Simply put, cases remaining connected in this final graph have to be connected in all data streams, so that the connected components of G identify clusters of cases likely to belong to the same outbreak cluster.
